alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued June 01 at 4:04AM AKDT until June 01 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Rain transitioning to snow before sunrise. Snow accumulations around 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin, mainly through the higher elevations of the Richardson, Glenn, and Tok Cutoff Highways. * WHEN...Through 10 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will mix with, and turn to, snow this morning as temperatures continue to fall. Amounts of 1 to 2 inches of snow are expected, specifically along the Glenn Highway from east of Eureka to just west of Glennallen. Additional accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are possible along the Richardson Hwy from Glennallen northward along the Richardson Highway to Paxson into Isabel Pass, as well as along the Tok Cutoff Highway to Mentasta Lake. Due to the temperatures being just cold enough for snow, snow accumulations could be either more than expected or stay mostly rain in some lower elevation regions of the Copper River Basin.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
